author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
Fixed [compat] issues on the latest commit. Will re-trigger registrator.

> Fixed [compat] issues on the latest commit. Will re-trigger registrator.

[noblock] Did I prevent the auto-merge because of this comment? It's been 4 days and I see no merging despite all checks have passed. Moreover, note that registration was re-triggered after the `[compat]` issue had been fixed. I'm puzzled, and i already have `v0.2.0` ready for registration, and another new dependent package that cannot be tested until `EngThermBase` gets registered...

> Did I prevent the auto-merge because of this comment?

Yes.  ***ALL*** messages must have `[noblock]` in order not to block registration.  For future reference, you can either edit the message to add `[noblock]` or delete it.

> > Did I prevent the auto-merge because of this comment?
> 
> Yes. _**ALL**_ messages must have `[noblock]` in order not to block registration. For future reference, you can either edit the message to add `[noblock]` or delete it.

Thanks for answering the query and for correctly closing the PR! üòÉ üëçüèº
